column4: What does this mean: "The channel demigods have stolen your voice"?
probably that some channel has you +q - are you registered?
+q is a mode that silences a user
depends - if you are registered normally you can speak in any channel
I don't know what #perl's policy is
in #ubuntu anyone can speak - within reason :)
within the Code of Conduct for Ubuntu
you might want to ask in #freenode, or /msg a freenode staff member
are you sure the ops in #perl didn't silence you? maybe /msg a #perl op or something
I take it you have now registered?
well, this isn't magic -if you change your nick you are no longer recognised
if you did *that* in #perl, you would never be allowed back, I would say
in many channels that would have been an automatic kick
you just spammed the channel with a huge paste
don't take anything too much to heart - IRC is a strange subculture with it's own netiquette and rules :)
